entries.meaning: A person skilled in exegesis; an interpreter of texts, difficult passages, signs, law, the words of an oracle, and similar obscure or esoteric sources.
examples: A text that could not speak to the present was dead, and the exegete had a duty to revive it.

verbs.description: exegete (third-person singular simple present exegetes, present participle exegeting, simple past and past participle exegeted)

entries.meaning: (chiefly religion) To interpret; to perform an exegesis.
